titleStmt.title: William B. James to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7441

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Franklin Simpson Co Ky
1st Decr 1865
Gov Thos E Bramlette
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

There is a Judgment in the Warren Circuit Court in favor of the Commonwealth against Wm Cullin on a forfeited recognisance as a witness. Which I am Satisfied aught to be remitted my attention was called to the matter a few days Since. A number of witnesses were recognised in Same Criminal prosecution in the penalty of one hundred dollars each (Cullen being one) and they all failed to attend. Their bonds were for forfeited, and at the next term all except Cullen Satisfactorily excused their absence to the Court and were released, The excuse of Cullen was the Same as the other but being very ignorant of legal matters, did not appear Supposing the excuse of Same would be Sufficient for all, I consequently took Judgment against him by default, Cullen has Since manifested no disinclination to attend as a witness. He is very poor, and has not
been in actual Contempt of the Authority of the Court, I shall release to Mr Cullen that portion of the Judgment belonging to me, And hope you will think proper to remit the whole Judgment,

Your friend
Wm B James atty for the Comth

Warren Cir Ct
vs
Wm Cullen
$100,
Forfeiture
Remitted
4 Dec/65
